question: What action by a tree is an example of organic weathering of rocks?

content.source_1: Organic (biological) weathering occurs when living organisms such as plants, animals, or microbes cause rock to break down.
content.source_2: Plant roots can grow into preâ€‘existing fractures in rock and exert pressure that widens the cracks and can split off pieces of the rock.
content.source_3: A tree is a living organism.
content.source_4: In process-based classifications, root wedging is categorized as mechanical (physical) weathering because it fractures rock by force without altering mineral chemistry.
content.source_5: Lichens and some microbes secrete organic acids that chemically dissolve minerals at rock surfaces; many texts treat this biochemical action as the paradigmatic form of organic weathering.

answer: tree roots growing in a fractured rock
